title: Ticket #6885: Allow multifile uploads
description:
The multi-file transfer plugins provide a richer communication mechanism between the file transfer object and the plugins; we have declared in #6859 that we want this to replace the single-file plugin as the default mechanism.

The biggest missing piece in the multifile setup in terms of functionality is the ability to upload (e.g., stageout for the condor_starter) using multifile plugins. This is the ticket to track that work.

I propose to keep the existing wire protocol. Instead of doing the transfers in the order provided by the user, we will first sort transfers to group all the files using the same plugin. As we loop through files, instead of immediately performing the transfer, we will build up a TODO list of "deferred" transfers.

Each time we hit a transfer incompatible with the current set of deferred transfers (or make it through the complete transfer list), we will execute the multifile plugin and send all the corresponding communication to the DoDownload-side. Here, "transfer incompatible" is any time where we change the protocol (http to https) or if the binary protocol requires us to do a round-trip and synchronize (see #6884; we have been recently surprised that for the last 9 years we always do a round-trip per file and plan to fix this).
remarks:
2019-Feb-09 10:19:21 by bbockelm:
This is pushed as

https://github.com/bbockelm/htcondor/tree/V8_9-multifile-upload

Waiting on #6876 before pushing it to gittrac as gittrac doesn't allow force-pushes for rewriting history.

2019-Feb-15 12:31:07 by tannenba:
Merged to master after a clean build/test run through BaTLab (build ID 461232)

2019-Apr-10 14:52:36 by coatsworth:
CODE REVIEW

  • The title of this ticket is inconsistent with the description. I don't see anything in the description about uploads. Please update it to better describe the actual work being done here.
  • file_transfer.cpp:3154 Should reference InvokeMultiUploadPlugin, not DoUpload
  • file_transfer.cpp:3351 Should use DIR_DELIM_CHAR
  • file_transfer.cpp:3641 What happens here if InvokeMultiUploadPlugin returns 0?

2019-Apr-11 12:52:39 by bbockelm:
  • The title of this ticket is inconsistent with the description. I don't see anything in the description about uploads. Please update it to better describe the actual work being done here.
    • Done.
  • file_transfer.cpp:3154 Should reference InvokeMultiUploadPlugin, not DoUpload
    • Done.
  • file_transfer.cpp:3351 Should use DIR_DELIM_CHAR
    • No, this is not a path, it is a URL. Forward slash is always correct for URL components.
  • file_transfer.cpp:3641 What happens here if InvokeMultiUploadPlugin returns 0?
    • I don't understand this comment. Did you get the incorrect line number? This is currently a dprintf statement that appears unrelated to upload plugins.

2019-Apr-12 11:47:59 by coatsworth:
Thanks for correction on the URL, somehow I missed that.

As for the last comment, I'm referencing line numbers as seen here: https://github.com/bbockelm/htcondor/blob/V8_9-multifile-upload/src/condor_utils/file_transfer.cpp

At lines 3465-3478, you check if InvokeMultiUploadPlugin() returns either -1 and 0, since these are both valid error codes meaning different things.

However at lines 3639-3641, you only check if InvokeMultiUploadPlugin() returns -1. I don't know if you care about a 0 error code, but I assumed if you care about it somewhere else then it probably matters here.

2019-Apr-15 08:25:18 by bbockelm:
Chatted with Mark on Friday to resolve the last point -

  • file_transfer.cpp:3641 What happens here if InvokeMultiUploadPlugin returns 0?
    • This case is checked in the ternary operator a few lines later.

With that, I think I have addressed all the review comments.

#6884   Do not perform a network turnaround for each file transfer
#6886   Improve multifile curl plugin to allow uploads
